title.rendered: To pay or not to pay: High Court decides on the levy of GST on vouchers

content.rendered:
As Digital India revolution rages in the country, there has been a significant transformation in the gifting industry.

Nowadays, gift cards, E-vouchers, cash back vouchers, etc. (hereby collectively referred as ‘vouchers’) have become extremely popular as they offer flexibility of choice and convenience of purchase and usage to the buyer and the receiver. Be it a wedding anniversary gift for a friend, a reward by an employer to an employee for good performance or a promotional scheme by ..
This ever-growing demand of vouchers is being satiated by companies who procure vouchers from their issuers and supply them to buyers. Till January 2023, the applicability of the Goods and Services Tax (GST) liability upon these vouchers was a grey area. On one hand, the Government was of the view that vouchers taxable as GST law specifically provides time of supply of goods and services in cases of vouchers.
On other hand, voucher trading companies believed that vouchers, being a mode of payment, are neither goods nor services and, therefore, there can be no levy of GST upon their supply. The Karnataka High Court recently examined this issue and, conclusively held that vouchers are exempted from the levy of GST.
